frame.name: Economy
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Political_region</fen>, often a nation, has an economic system, the<fen>Economy</fen>, defined by the level of production and consumption of goods and services. The <fen>Market_type</fen> or <fen>Domain</fen> may be specified.
<ex>The <fex name="pol">Canadian</fex> <t><fex name="Economy">economy</fex></t> will continue to expand in 2005.</ex> <ex>Medical industry is a new force in the <fex name="dom">industrial</fex> <t><fex name="Economy">economy</fex></t> <fex name="pol">of Lin'an</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Political_region
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Political_region</fen> is the nation, state, or other political body within which an economic system exists.</def-root>

FE.name: Economy
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Economy</fen> is the state of the <fen>Political_region</fen> as defined by the production, consumption, etc. of goods and services.</def-root>

FE.name: Domain
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Domain</fen> of the state for which the <fen>Economy</fen> is being considered.
<ex>In this way the <fex name="dom">agrarian</fex> <t>economy</t> of the mainland might have proceeded towards a further specialization in agricultural products and a more effective production of food.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Market_type
FE.definition:
<def-root>The type of economic market in which the <fen>Economy</fen> exists.
<ex>For much of its post-1947 history, India ran a <fex name="mar">socialist</fex> <t>economy</t>.</ex> <ex>China's <fex name="mar">free-market</fex> <t>economy</t> is generating unprecedented but not unlimited press freedoms, and there's momentum.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition:
<def-root>A further depction of the <fen>Economy</fen>.
<ex>Hertfordshire enjoys a <fex name="des">buoyant</fex> <t>economy</t>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: economy.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the state of a country or region in terms of the production and consumption of goods and services and the supply of money.

lexUnit.name: economic.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: of or relating to economics or the economy.
